headline: Restaurant-Style French Onion Soup
description: This French onion soup tastes just like at a restaurant, full of beefy wine and sherry broth, topped with toasted French bread and 2 kinds of cheese.

video.description: A blend of two different cheeses compliments this soup!
video.name: Restaurant-Style French Onion Soup

name: Restaurant-Style French Onion Soup
recipeIngredient: 0.5 teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste
1 French baguette, cut into 1/2-inch thick slices
2 tablespoons olive oil, or as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Melt butter in a large stockpot over medium heat. Cook and stir onions, garlic, thyme, salt, and pepper in hot butter until onions are soft and brown, about 30 minutes.
Pour in red wine and sherry; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer until you can no longer smell alcohol cooking off, about 15 minutes.
Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Sprinkle onion mixture with flour and stir until coated; cook for 10 minutes. Pour in broth, stir to blend in flour, and simmer until slightly thickened, about 20 minutes.

While soup is simmering, arrange baguette slices on a baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil. Bake baguette slices in the preheated oven until golden brown, 12 to 14 minutes, flipping slices halfway through baking. Set aside.
Set an oven rack about 8 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.

Ladle soup into 6 oven-proof crocks, filling them about 3/4 full. Place 1 or 2 toasted baguette slices over each soup serving, then top each with a Swiss cheese and provolone slice. Carefully place filled crocks onto a sturdy baking sheet.
Cook soup under the preheated broiler until cheese is browned and bubbly, 3 to 4 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Will never have it out again! I will make it at home.

Growing up, I never liked French onion soup, I just didn’t get all the hype. And even as I grew older; it’s onions and broth, big deal. I’m now 62, and just made this, begrudgingly, at the request of a friend. Found this recipe and... BIG DEAL! BIG DEAL! This is amazing! Now I get it! This was so impressive that I am having my neighbors over for a meal of this soup. Yep, I am official on the French onion soup campaign. Thank you SSSOOOO MUCH!!! I LOVE, LOVE THIS!

I’ve made this a few times, trying to put my edge on it, and taking a few variations from other recipes, until I think I have my own, reproducible soup. I almost always add a few anchovies to any sweet n savory grill. I added a tablespoon of sugar to the sautéing onions. My grandmother always said: A little sugar in the pot, Gives it what it hasn’t got. Just delicious, even without the additions.

By Far, the best French Onion Soup that I ever made. The key was cooking the onions down until golden brown. That really gave them a deep caramelized flavor. I cooked them longer than the 30 minutes in the recipe. I also substituted gruyere for the provolone, but that is just a personal preference. You have to try this recipe
It was good though not as rich as others that I have made.

This is a very rich soup, definitely like something from a restaurant! I caramelized the onions for about an hour and sautéed the garlic separate. I added the full amount of wine in the recipe, however the flavor was a bit too rich and I think I will cut it in half next time. I used Mushroom Broth from this website for the broth to make this vegetarian. Overall, great recipe, I will surely make this again!

Loved this! After traveling this summer my husband declared his most favorite soup was French Onion Soup. I solved the problem mentioned in reviews that the onions took much longer to cook, by dividing the onion step into 2 pots so it took 30 minutes! That’s the only tip I can make, I followed the rest of the recipe as written. Definitely will make again.
Very tasty. Not nearly as salty as other restaurant versions. Thank you!
My family loved it but I did substitute Gruyere cheese for swiss and provolone and garlicked the bread before toasting in oven. Definitely will make again.
This is my favorite recipe for onion soup and I have tried multiple ones . When I have guests and serve this dish it gets lots of love!
Soooooo awesome, we had company and everyone loved it!
Cut down on amount of onions if your belly is sensitive like mine . It was delicious but had a belly ache that night ...

Great flavor!! I used 3 jumbo sweet onions in this and made my own broth from Better Than Bouillon. I used provolone and mozzarella over the baguette. I also had to cook down my onions for about 40-45 mins instead of 30.

Made mine in the slower cooker. Butter and onions started on high for an hour or so and then put on low for 8 to 10 hours. Used 1/4 to 1/2 cup good sherry - no wine. Added everything else besides bread and cheese. Let sit over night and rewarmed before adding to oven the bread and cheese on top. By sitting, all flavors came together perfectly.
Excellent recipe. I followed it explicitly and the result was first class. Shared with others who were impressed!
I made no changes and it did turn out surprisingly good. No left overs.
love this recipe

Nov 2020 Excellent method for French Onion Soup. Used a store-brand beef broth that ended up not being very flavorful. Added a few dashes of soy sauce and Worcestershire. Added a bay leaf, garlic powder (in addition to the fresh garlic). Once added extras was very good. Used shiraz for the wine (a little less than 1 cup, was tentative about too strong of a wine flavor). Used vermouth instead of sherry (just what I had). Used gruyere to be traditional instead of swiss/provolone but that is so expensive, next time I'll try the the swiss/provolone as is recommended in the recipe. In the end I was very happy with the result.
This was the best French onion soup I have ever made! I didn’t have sherry, so I used white wine instead. Thank You!!
This was SO good! I halved the recipe but followed it exactly. I used yellow onions. This is going in my paper collection of recipes, it is THAT tasty. Thank you for sharing this!
Fantastic!
My husband loves French Onion Soup. I looked through several recipes for it before selecting this one. It was easy to make and so very good. He was thrilled. This is a keeper. Thanks.
Made it for my family and everyone loved it. Will make this again. It was easy and delicious.
Not bad.

One of the better French Onion soup recipes I've run across. Followed the recipe, but the one thing I think it's missing and would make it 5 stars is perhaps reducing down the onions, deglazing with water, reduce, deglaze, for maybe 2 or 3 cycles. I think that would build up even more flavor.
Followed the recipe and turn out was great. Thank You.

I used Yellow, White and Purple Onions . 2 large of each . 
Also 8 large cloves of garlic . 
Four cheeses : 
Shaved Parm in bottom 
Swiss, Gruyere, and provolone on top .
Followed the recipe exactly. Was the french onion soup I've ever had. Thank you so much for posting.
Very easy. I really enjoyed it!
Loved it! Used a combo of white, sweet, and regular yellow onions. Turned out amazing!

We love this onion soup! I have made it several times. We like it so much I make a double batch every time. The only thing I change is that I add more onions than the recipe calls for. I recommend this to anyone who likes onion soup.
We find this recipe to be awesome! We have made this 4 times now and everyone loves it. This is my go to French onion soup recipe from now on!
Excellent rainy day soup
So flavorful
Delicious! Followed recipe to the letter.

Love it- teenage grandkids loved it. Changed nothing but figured out it's an adaptable recipe so small tweaking to suit taste would work. I did add more salt & pepper to taste. This goes into the soup rotation here!
Actually tasted like a rest. style French onion soup! I was prepared to work my way through 50 recipes until I found it, but got lucky on the first try
This was fantastic! I made it just like the recipe called for except for the sherry as I did not have any. It was exactly what I wanted it to taste like.
This is my go to recipe.. Everyone loves it..

I added 1 tsp sugar, thought it tasted a little bitter. I also added 1 tbsp. Worcestershire sauce. Tasted better after those changes. I probably really should just have simmered longer before tasting.

I made this for my wife and daughter for lunch and we all loved it. Made it as written except I cooked down the onions a bit longer. Very easy recipe and was perfect for a winter lunch.
I will be making this again.

Holy cow this is good! I started with 5 pounds of giant sweet onions. I caramelized the onions for well over 30 minutes until they were golden brown. I substituted fresh thyme and a good Sauvignon Blanc (for the red wine). I used shredded gruyere and a slice of provolone over toasted homemade croutons in the soups crocks. This will be my new french onions soup recipe!

I made this for the first time pretty much as written from an ingredient standpoint. It was delicious. I wasn't sure what size or type of onion to get so I bought sweet onions, 6 in all as the sizes were med to large. At first I thought it was too much but after things sweat down it was a good ratio.

I wasn't in any hurry so I let the soup simmer and meld for probably 4 hours. I wanted to add more flour early on, but I didn't as I knew it would be on the stove for awhile. I am glad I didn't, each time I skimmed the top a bit more thickness and scrapings off the pot mixed right in.

I was maybe a little heavy on the sherry, pepper and salt, but that is just me. I made it ahead of tomorrow for Bowl Games, so like I said, no rush, if I were not letting things simmer that long, I might have added more flour and / or boiled a little harder.

I did use 1 quart each of beef stock and beef broth. We tend to lean to stock when cooking.

I added twice the amount of cheese, just because I feel like there is never enough cheese ever... Broiled in a good old fashioned crock. 

I am not a huge cook and do not stray too far from a recipe for the first time...but with the additional simmering, melding, and stirring time involved, this was really as good as I have had anywhere. Looking forward to tomorrows meal.

Good soup. Take you time.. watch the onions closely.. simmer longer.. I used more Flour 3 Tbs.. cook the flour taste out... use Wondra. Flour.. my family wants me to make this again soon... I made this Vegetarian...really good recipe...

So delicious! I didn't have sherry, so I omitted it and it was still wonderful. The video helped because I would have cooked the onions too long waiting for them to darken, when you add the wine, they darken nicely during that simmer. I will definitely make this again!
Actually, I have made this several times. This recipe is wonderful. My family loves this in the fall and winter. I have not made any changes to the recipe, personally didn't need to. Enjoy!
Turned out great and delicious. Didn't have Sherry in hand, but otherwise, I followed the recipe exactly. Could probably use a little more salt
My husband says it's delicious!
I added dry french onion soup mix with the flour. Added more flavor
Just needs Dijon mustard added!!
Great basic recipe. Added extra thyme.
Excellent. Sure not going to be the last time I make it.

Oh My! This recipe is delicious! After making this I felt like a trained chef. I used beef BONE broth instead of beef broth as I believe is has more flavor and know is has more nutrients. Bone broth is available almost everywhere now. Try this one!
So good, but exchanged the Swiss for a mix of Provolone, mozzarella, and a little Parmigiana. Will definitely make again.
I thought this was excellent...made as directed. Kids, of course, didn’t like it. “Too oniony!”

I really liked this soup! It had lots of flavor and wasn't too hard or long to make. The reason why I did not give this recipe a five star was because I'm not totally into the cooked wine flavor, I feel like it was a bit too strong. Maybe that's just this kind of soup, I don't know, but I wasn't very fond of it.

Great rich soup! I used 4 vidalia onions and 1 red onion, some minced garlic, 32 oz beef broth, 1/2 cup red wine, then added 2 more cups from beef broth concentrate. The onions took almost an hour to get to the level of softness I prefer, but man was it worth the wait! Fantastic recipe!

I just made this recipe! It's very good. We all tend to add, subtract or substitute. When I try any new soup recipe I never add salt until the end. So with this one, because I used salted butter I needed no additional salt. Same with the sugar, add it at the end after a taste test. Thank you. I'll make this recipe again!

This soup is heavenly. It does make a pretty big pot of soup so we have sealed and frozen some for later as well. I found the soup to taste even better day two after it sat in the fridge overnight. Great recipe and so glad I found it!
Definitely will make again. Used gruyere instead of Swiss (just not a big fan of Swiss cheese)
Will make many more times
Followed the recipe exactly as written, it was ok but just felt like something was missing

If you have plenty of time, this recipe is worth the effort. Be sure to continually scrape up the fond on the bottom of the pan for the ultimate flavor. I used boxed beef broth, and perhaps I would have liked it a little better if I had used my homemade broth.
Great recipe as is!

This recipe turned out delicious!!!! Just as it says, “Restaurant-Style French Onion Soup”. My husband loves French onion soup and orders it frequently, he said it was better than the restaurant’s! My kids also loved it. Also, I enjoyed making this beautiful dish, can’t wait to make it again and again and again... You get the picture.
I made this recipe exactly as stated for a dinner party at my home. Unbelievably delicious. I will definitely make again...
This French onion soup does remind me of tasty restaurant soups. This was actually pretty easy to make and well worth the time. I will definitely be making this again!

Good, tasty, pretty much per the recipe with perhaps a big more sherry and little less red. Otherwise on target. Not special, not wow, but very good. Next time I'm changing the cheese to gruyere, which I 've seen when dining out.

This is seriously the best french onion soup ever!!! My family and I absolutely love french onion soup and we always order when out to dinner...well no longer because this is better then most restaurants. Thank you so much for this amazing recipe...my kids asked for me to make this at least once a month. I followed the recipe to a T except only using provolone cheese because I didn't have swiss. I used my dutch oven (if you follow it trust me you won't be disappointed)
Great starter recipe. Great instructions.... The soup was too runny as is, i recommed simmering a long time for reduction or use less broth.
I used low sodium broth, which I think was a mistake. Skipped the wine. Felt like it was missing a flavor, but not sure what.
I didn't have any garlic, so I left it out. This is my favorite recipe so far! Family loved it, and I can't wait to make it again.

I made this two nights ago, and it was one of the yummiest things I've ever made! I made few changes: (1) I omitted the bread (hubby's diabetic, and onions are high enough on the glycemic index!), (2) I only used 6 onions, as the ones I had were HUGE, and (3) I only used Swiss cheese cos that's what I had in the house. Do follow the directions, especially the one that says to cook after adding the wines til all the alcohol smell is gone. HOLY DELICIOUSNESS!!
The flavor of this soup is good. My onions did not get very caramelized or brown in the time given. The next day I used croutons instead of the French baguette and we liked that better.

This is a very good recipe. I, personally, screwed it up by using Sweet Onions instead of Yellow Onions. Also, should have used Dry Sherry instead of Cooking Sherry. I bought my vittles on Sunday at which time we can't purchase alcohol in Tennessee. 
I'll make this again with the above changes. The family enjoyed it.
Perfect. Added burgundy wine cause that’s what I had
Great recipe for French Onion Soup. Like other reviewers mentioned it took longer than 30 minutes to brown the onions, about 45 minutes. We really enjoyed the finished product. Thanks for sharing.

OMG! I love spending time preparing a good meal. This recipe was the absolute best.and did not disappoint.Fun to make and absolutely one one of the best onion soup recipes we have ever had had. Well worth the tears shed getting the onions sliced and caramelized. This one is a winner.
Next time I will use the low sodium broth and not use quite as much red wine. Other than that it was great.
Wonderful soup and I’m making it again today ??
I could not find my tried and true onion soup recipe. I had some leftover red wine so decided to try it! I will make this again. My husband raved about it.

Quote my very picky husband "the best French Onion Soup I've ever had." I followed the suggestion in another review and used half Beef Stock and half Beef Broth. Besides this, I followed the recipe exactly and it was delicious!!! The wine and sherry did take me quite a bit longer - maybe 30-40min - to cook down, but worth the wait. All in all, this was an easy recipe. The only downside is now I can no longer appreciate French Onion Soup in the fine restaurants (well, maybe that's not so bad :)
I've tried other French Onion Soup recipes, and so far this is the best! Cutting onions was the worst part, but I love how you can taste real onion on every bit.
I used a little bit of stock instead of all broth because I’m very bold with flavor. Came out great.
My family like this soup, but didn't love it. It didn't have a deep flavor. Next time I would add some better than bouillon beef flavor. Otherwise it was easy to make and pretty tasty.
I will definitely make it again added a little Lea n Perrin’s
I will definitely make it again added a little Lea n Perrin’s

Making it today for a second time, will freeze some for Christmas time. I used gluten-free flour and beef broth to suit a frequent guest, and it was delicious. I used swiss cheese and served small quanities in ramekins, just the right amount for before the main course. Onions took longer to brown, as said by others. Great recipe!
Exceptional flavor, wonderful french onion soup. Family is loving it!
This was a fabulous recipe. The only thing I changed is I added a bit more sherry and thyme for my tastes. I loved this!!!
Made as written. Just so-so. Not bad, not great.

This soup turned out brilliantly. The broth was perfect, rich, flavourful, not too salty. I didn't have red wine on hand so just used a good sipping sherry . . . I think this change will stick because the richness/sweetness complimented the caramelized onions incredibly well. I topped with toasted garlicky baguette croutons, and tons of smoked gruyere. Delectable!!

The thyme was overpowering. Not a spice I expect in really good onion soup, and that is most of what caused a four star rating. I transferred this soup to the electric pressure cooker, added Worcestershire sauce, and Soy Sauce, plus a bit more salt and "bang," Houston we have the real deal onion soup. Obviously I am in a minority here, it definitely is a great recipe whether it tripped my taste triggers or not!
Great Recipe! Really tastes like the ones you get at a restaurant!

Unfortunately I didn't have any sherry on hand so I just left it out. That was a mistake as the soup would have had more body to the flavour. Great recipe. I will definitely make it again and put the sherry in next time.

I also pan fried some rib eyes that were in the freezer, deglazed the pan with red wine, and put that all in the stock. I let it simmer for about 3 hours, shredded the beef and put the beef at the bottom of the bowl for a yummy surprise.
It was amazing! One of the best I've had.
Best FO soup I've ever had. Followed the recipe exactly (just cut it in half). This will be my new go-to FO soup recipe from now on!

I made a smaller batch and shortened some of the cooking times. The flour adds a creaminess to the broth. Substituted mozza for the provolone - it's what I had on hand. Added a bit of beef bouillon and cut back on salt. Used cooking sherry and a shiraz caberet leftover bottle of wine. All in all, one of the best french onion soups that I have had. Delicious.
